mclient is needed to fetch existing documents via getDocument()
Fixes ReferenceError when loading existing documents

changes.subject: Merge pull request #7 from Bwilliamson55/dev
notes: Fix primary key retrieval to use getRawIndexes instead of fetchPrimar…

changes.subject: Fix primary key retrieval to use getRawIndexes instead of fetchPrimaryKey
notes: Replace mclient.fetchPrimaryKey() with indexesStore.getPrimaryKey()
fetchPrimaryKey() was incorrectly returning the distinct attribute instead of the actual primary key
getPrimaryKey() now correctly retrieves primaryKey from getRawIndexes() response
Added getPrimaryKey method to indexes-store with caching and fallback logic
Updated IndexDetailPage and DocumentDetailPage to use the new method
Fixes issue where document IDs showed as undefined when primary key wasn't 'id'

changes.subject: Merge pull request #6 from Bwilliamson55/dev
notes: Dev

changes.subject: Fix search state persistence bugs
notes: Bug 1: Prevent SearchStateWatcher from overwriting saved state on initial mount
Remove immediate: true from watcher to prevent firing before ais-configure applies saved state
Add initialization delay to allow ais-configure to restore saved state first
Add checks to prevent saving empty state that would overwrite saved settings
Only save state after seeing meaningful changes or after initialization period
Bug 2: Fix filtersVisible handling when switching between indices
Watch route.params.uid instead of currentIndex to properly detect navigation
Save old index's filtersVisible BEFORE loading new index state
Reload filtersVisible from saved state when switching indices via loadInstance()
Prevent saving new index's filtersVisible to old index's state

changes.subject: Fix primary key handling and add search state persistence
notes: Fix undefined document ID in URL when primary key is not 'id'
Add fallback to 'id' when fetchPrimaryKey() returns null
Add getDocumentId() helper function for safe primary key access
Apply fix to both IndexDetailPage and DocumentDetailPage
Add search state persistence across page navigation
Store search query, filters, sort, page, and filter visibility per index
Restore search state when returning to index detail page
Persist state using Pinia store with localStorage
Add SearchStatePersistence component to watch and save state changes

changes.subject: Merge pull request #5 from Bwilliamson55/dev
notes: Release 11/14/25

changes.subject: feat(search): Enhance InstantSearch filters with dark mode, better UX, and prettier scrollbars
notes: IMPROVEMENTS - IndexDetailPage.vue:
Comprehensive dark mode support throughout search interface
* Document cards, headers, field labels all with dark: variants
* Filter section text and backgrounds (dark:text-white, dark:text-gray-200)
* Empty state icons and messages
* Hover states on cards (dark:hover:border-primary)
Tailwind CSS migration for search area
* Replaced q-pa-md → p-4, q-mb-md → mb-4, q-my-md → my-4
* Replaced q-py-xl → py-16, q-mt-lg → mt-8
* Replaced text-grey-7 → text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-400
* Consistent spacing throughout
Better filter UX
* Filters collapsed by default with :default-opened="false"
* Active filter count badges per attribute with getActiveFilterCount()
* Custom expansion headers showing attribute name + count
* Prettier scrollbars with q-scroll-area (4px width, 50% opacity)
* Scrollable filter section: height calc(100vh - 300px) for overflow handling
IMPROVEMENTS - AisRefinementList.vue:
Show More/Less functionality
* Uses InstantSearch's toggleShowMore and canToggleShowMore
* Button appears only when needed
* Expand/collapse icons for visual feedback
Enhanced filter list UI
* Prettier scrollbars with q-scroll-area replacing native overflow
* Dynamic height: auto for short lists, 256px max for long lists
* Hover states: hover:bg-gray-100 dark:hover:bg-gray-800
* Dynamic badge colors: primary for active filters, grey for inactive
Dark mode support
* All text with dark:text-gray-200
* Hover backgrounds for light and dark modes
* Empty state message with proper dark mode styling
Tailwind migration
* Replaced q-pt-xs → pt-2, q-px-xs q-py-xs → px-1 py-1
* Replaced q-pr-sm → pr-2
IMPROVEMENTS - AisCurrentRefinements.vue:
Dark mode support for active filter chips
* Added dark:bg-primary dark:text-white classes
* Chips maintain visibility in both modes
Tailwind cleanup
* Removed q-mb-md default from containerClass
* Added mb-4 directly in template for consistency
TECHNICAL CHANGES:
Added getActiveFilterCount() helper in IndexDetailPage
Added activeFilters ref for tracking filter state
q-scroll-area with custom thumb styling for consistent scrollbars
Conditional rendering for empty states in refinement lists
Dynamic height calculation based on item count
UX BENEFITS:
Handles 50+ filterable attributes without UI breaking
Handles 100+ facet values with scrolling + Show More
Clear visual feedback for active filters with counts and badges
Prettier, consistent scrollbars across light and dark modes
Progressive disclosure: collapsed filters, expandable on demand
FILES CHANGED:
src/pages/IndexDetailPage.vue (ENHANCED - dark mode, scrollbars, filter UX)
src/components/aisComponents/AisRefinementList.vue (ENHANCED - show more, scrollbars, dark mode)
src/components/aisComponents/AisCurrentRefinements.vue (ENHANCED - dark mode)

changes.subject: feat(indexes): Modernize IndexPage and SidebarSettings with store pattern and dark mode
notes: NEW FEATURES:
Created indexes-store.js for centralized index state management
* Stats getter: total indexes, total documents, recently updated count
* Actions: fetchIndexes, getIndex, createIndex, deleteIndex, createDump
* Loading states and error handling
* HMR support for development
IndexPage stats dashboard with 3 metric cards
* Total indexes count
* Total documents across all indexes
* Recently updated indexes (24h window)
Index search/filter functionality
* Client-side filtering by index UID
* Live updates with computed filteredIndexes
* Empty state messages for no results
Create Index dialog modal
* Moved from inline form to persistent dialog
* Header button for quick access
* Form validation and loading states
IMPROVEMENTS:
IndexPage.vue (323 lines → cleaner architecture)
* Comprehensive dark mode support (all text, backgrounds, hover states)
* Replaced direct API calls with store methods
* Removed unused imports
* Better visual hierarchy with icons and spacing
* Improved button labels and tooltips
* Empty states for unconfigured instance and no indexes
* Consistent patterns with TasksPage and KeysPage
SidebarSettings.vue (253 lines → better UX)
* Comprehensive dark mode support throughout
* Removed unused MeiliSearch import
* Replaced non-Tailwind classes (border-bottom, active-class)
* Improved header layout and typography
* Current context info in highlighted card
* Active instance visual feedback with blue background
* Modernized documentation link with icon
* Empty state for no instances
* Better button tooltips and sizing
* Loading state on Add Instance button
TECHNICAL CHANGES:
indexes-store.js (117 lines)
* Pinia store with getters and actions
* Uses settingsStore.client getter for Meilisearch access
* Stats calculations with reduce and filter operations
* Automatic index refresh after create/delete
* Consistent pattern with tasks-store and keys-store
DRY refactoring
* Eliminated repetitive client calls
* Single loadInstance() function
* Centralized error handling patterns
Pattern consistency
* All stores follow same naming: useTasksStore, useKeysStore, useIndexesStore
* All pages follow same structure: stats → search → list → dialogs
* All use centralized notification utilities
* All use settingsStore.client getter consistently
FILES CHANGED:
src/stores/indexes-store.js (CREATED - 117 lines)
src/pages/IndexPage.vue (MODERNIZED - 323 lines)
src/pages/SidebarSettings.vue (MODERNIZED - 253 lines)

changes.subject: feat(keys): Modernize KeysPage with Pinia store, Tailwind, and UX improvements
notes: BREAKING CHANGES:
KeysPage now uses keys-store for state management instead of direct API calls
NEW FEATURES:
Created keys-store.js with comprehensive state management
* Stats getter: total, expiringSoon, expired, neverExpire counts
* Actions: fetchKeys, getKey, createKey, updateKey, deleteKey
* Key visibility tracking per key (keyVisible property)
* Security: API keys not persisted to localStorage
Added stats dashboard with 4 metric cards
* Total keys, expiring soon (30 days), expired, never expire
* Color-coded indicators for quick status assessment
Implemented search/filter functionality
* Client-side filtering by name, description, or UID
* Computed filteredKeys property with live updates
Copy-to-clipboard functionality
* Added copy buttons to all key input fields
* Uses Quasar copyToClipboard utility with success notifications
* Tooltip hints for better UX
Expiration status badges
* Color-coded badges in custom expansion headers
* Red = expired, Orange = expiring soon (<30 days), Green = future, Blue = never
* Helper function getExpirationBadge() for status logic
Create Key dialog modal
* Moved form from expansion panel to persistent dialog
* Header button for quick access
* Auto-refresh keys list on successful creation
IMPROVEMENTS:
Migrated from Quasar utility classes to Tailwind CSS
* Replaced q-pa-*, q-mt-*, row/col with Tailwind equivalents
* Consistent spacing: p-4, gap-4, mt-2, mb-6 patterns
Comprehensive dark mode support
* All text: dark:text-gray-200/300/400
* All backgrounds: dark:bg-gray-800
* Stats cards, expansion items, key detail sections
Custom expansion headers
* Display key name, UID, and expiration badge
* Better visual hierarchy with icons and spacing
Refactored key card references
* Fixed array index mismatch issue with filtered keys
* Changed from iKeys.results[i] to direct key object usage
* Updated onSubmit to use UID lookup instead of array index
TECHNICAL CHANGES:
keys-store.js (194 lines)
* Pinia store with HMR support
* Getters for stats and key organization
* Actions handle all CRUD operations
* Loading states and error handling
KeysPage.vue (420 lines)
* Header with Refresh and Create Key buttons
* Stats cards section with responsive grid
* Search filter bar
* Custom expansion headers with badges
* Key detail cards with copy functionality
* Create Key dialog with ApiKeyForm
Helper functions
* copyKeyToClipboard() - Clipboard with notifications
* getExpirationBadge() - Status and color logic
* formatDate() - Consistent date formatting
* filteredKeys computed - Live search filtering
ApiKeyForm.vue dark mode fixes
* Tailwind migration for consistency
* Dark mode text and background colors
FILES CHANGED:
src/stores/keys-store.js (CREATED)
src/pages/KeysPage.vue (MODERNIZED)
src/components/ApiKeyForm.vue (UPDATED)

changes.subject: feat: Complete TasksPage rewrite with modern UI and Pinia integration
notes: Completely rebuilt TasksPage with comprehensive task management features:
Core Features:
Stats cards showing total/succeeded/processing/failed task counts
Advanced filtering: text search, multi-select status/type/index filters
Expandable row details with structured task information
Task cancellation (single and bulk operations with confirmation)
Color-coded status badges and task type icons
Human-readable duration and date formatting
Auto-refresh for active tasks (10-second polling)
Empty state with helpful messaging
Technical Implementation:
Created dedicated tasks-store.js with Pinia for centralized state
Store getters: stats, taskTypes, indexUids, tasksByStatus, recentTasks
Store actions: fetchTasks, getTask, cancelTasks, deleteTasks, waitForTask
Fixed Meilisearch SDK v0.53.0 API compatibility (client.tasks.* namespace)
Centralized notifications for all user feedback
DRY refactor: dynamic detail rendering with helper functions
Dark mode support throughout component
UI/UX Improvements:
Responsive grid layout for stats and filters
Multi-select checkboxes for bulk operations
Expandable details panel with task info, timeline, errors, and raw JSON
Material icons for task types (add_circle, delete, settings, etc.)
Error display in red banner with clickable documentation links
Column definitions generated programmatically from config object
Component Structure:
~520 lines total (reduced from initial 570 via DRY refactor)
Separation of concerns: display logic in component, business logic in store
Computed properties for filtering and store access
Lifecycle hooks: auto-refresh on mount, cleanup on unmount
Follows project patterns: Tailwind utilities, Quasar components, centralized
notifications, store-based architecture, dark mode awareness

changes.subject: refactor(settings): modularize SettingsForm into focused components
notes: Break down monolithic 1200+ line SettingsForm.vue into 8 specialized components:
**Component Architecture:**
Main SettingsForm.vue: Orchestration layer (~250 lines)
* State management (iSettings, originalSettings)
* Change tracking with deep watcher
* API calls (load/submit settings)
* Event coordination between child components
src/components/settings/:
* PresetSelector.vue - Preset buttons with detailed info dialog
* SettingsBanners.vue - Unsaved/reindexing warning banners
* SearchTab.vue - displayedAttributes, searchableAttributes, filterableAttributes, sortableAttributes
* RelevancyTab.vue - rankingRules, distinctAttribute, stopWords, synonyms, typoTolerance
* SynonymsSection.vue - Complete synonym CRUD with CSV import/export
* TypoToleranceSection.vue - Typo tolerance configuration
* PerformanceTab.vue - pagination, faceting with performance indicators
* ReorderDialogs.vue - Drag-and-drop reorder dialogs for searchable/ranking
**Technical Details:**
Props flow down: modelValue, hasFieldChanged function
Events bubble up: apply-preset, show-searchable-reorder, show-ranking-reorder
Fixed v-model on props error in ReorderDialogs (use :model-value + @update:model-value)
Consistent orange border styling for modified fields
Centralized notifications utility usage throughout
**Benefits:**
Improved maintainability (focused components vs monolithic)
Better code organization (single responsibility per component)
Easier testing and debugging
Reduced cognitive load when making changes
Files:
Modified: src/components/SettingsForm.vue (1200→250 lines)
Created: src/components/settings/PresetSelector.vue
Created: src/components/settings/SettingsBanners.vue
Created: src/components/settings/SearchTab.vue
Created: src/components/settings/RelevancyTab.vue
Created: src/components/settings/SynonymsSection.vue
Created: src/components/settings/TypoToleranceSection.vue
Created: src/components/settings/PerformanceTab.vue
Created: src/components/settings/ReorderDialogs.vue
Backup: src/components/SettingsForm.old.vue (original preserved)

changes.subject: Complete settings form refactor with enhanced UX
notes: Major improvements to SettingsForm.vue with better user experience and data loss prevention:
**Settings Management:**
Added 4 quick preset buttons (E-commerce, Blog, Documentation, Fast Search)
Implemented detailed preset info dialog with expandable setting breakdowns
Added "Reset to Original" button to discard unsaved changes
Created settings-config.js with complete metadata for all Meilisearch settings
**Visual Feedback:**
Orange border indicators on modified fields
Orange "Modified" badge for Typo Tolerance section
Unsaved changes warning banner (orange)
Re-indexing warning banner showing affected fields (yellow)
Real-time JSON viewer for complete settings object
**Synonyms Improvements:**
Replaced vertical layout with compact q-table
Added CSV import/export functionality (papaparse)
Inline editable synonym chips with remove buttons
"Add" chip button per synonym group
Fixed Enter key submission bug (now only adds synonym, doesn't submit form)
**Change Tracking:**
Pinia store integration with hasUnsavedSettings flag
Deep watcher comparing against originalSettings
Browser beforeunload warning prevents accidental data loss
Visual indicators automatically clear after save
**Contextual Help:**
Created SettingsHelp.vue component with help dialogs
Help buttons on all fields with descriptions, performance impact, and Meilisearch docs links
Reorder dialogs for searchable attributes and ranking rules with priority explanations
**Notifications:**
Centralized notification utilities (no direct $q.notify or $q.dialog calls)
Added showPrompt() function for text input dialogs
Updated copilot-instructions.md with notification patterns
**Dark Mode:**
Updated color palette to blue-gray (#1a1f2e, #151824)
Consistent dark mode styling across all dialogs
**Technical:**
Metadata-driven UI with SETTINGS_METADATA
Tab interface: Search Behavior, Relevancy, Performance
Drag-and-drop reordering with vue-draggable-plus
Dependencies added:
vue-draggable-plus: ^0.6.0
papaparse: ^5.x.x
